title: Hash Map and Set Quiz
description: Test key design, frequency counting, and lookup patterns.

questions.question: What is usually the most important decision in a hash-map solution?
options: Which key and value to store
questions.explanation: Key/value design determines whether operations answer the needed query efficiently.

questions.question: A hash set is most directly used for:
questions.explanation: Sets track existence, making membership checks efficient.

questions.question: Complement lookup (like Two Sum) typically improves complexity from:
questions.explanation: One pass plus average O(1) lookup avoids nested scans.

questions.question: If order of appearance matters after counting, a common pattern is:
options: Build frequency then do a second pass over original data
questions.explanation: Second pass preserves original order while using precomputed counts.

questions.question: Which statement about hash map performance is accurate?
options: Lookups are always O(1) worst-case guaranteed
Lookups are O(1) average with possible worse collisions
questions.explanation: Average behavior is constant-time, but worst-case can degrade.

questions.question: For counting characters in a string, best starting value in map is typically:
questions.explanation: Incrementing from default 0 is the standard frequency map pattern.
